data_types.name: bool
data_types.description: Used to represent Boolean values (True or False).

data_types.name: str
data_types.description: Used to represent strings of characters.

data_types.name: list
data_types.description: Used to represent ordered sequences of elements.

data_types.name: tuple
data_types.description: Used to represent immutable ordered sequences of elements.

data_types.name: dict
data_types.description: Used to represent mappings of keys to values.

variables.name: Declaring variables
variables.description: Variables are created when they are first assigned a value.

variables.name: Naming variables
variables.description: Variable names must start with a letter or underscore and can contain letters, numbers, and underscores.

variables.name: Variable assignment
variables.description: Variables can be assigned values using the assignment operator (=).

variables.name: Variable types
variables.description: The type of a variable is determined by the type of the value it holds.

loops.name: for loops
loops.description: Used to iterate over a sequence of elements.

loops.name: while loops
loops.description: Used to execute a block of code repeatedly as long as a condition is true.

loops.name: range function
loops.description: Used to generate a sequence of numbers that can be used to control the number of iterations in a loop.

conditional_statements.name: if statements
conditional_statements.description: Used to execute a block of code if a condition is true.

conditional_statements.name: else statements
conditional_statements.description: Used to execute a block of code if the condition in the corresponding if statement is false.

conditional_statements.name: elif statements
conditional_statements.description: Used to test additional conditions if the conditions in the preceding if or elif statements are false.

conditional_statements.name: logical operators
conditional_statements.description: Used to combine multiple conditions in a single if statement.
